abstract: The home improvement retailer reached an agreement with a large shareholder that will prevent a proxy fight over the company’s strategy.
snippet: The home improvement retailer reached an agreement with a large shareholder that will prevent a proxy fight over the company’s strategy.
lead_paragraph: Home Depot, the home improvement retailer, reached an agreement last night with a large shareholder, Relational Investors, that will prevent a proxy fight over the company’s strategy.

headline.main: Home Depot Proxy Fight Is Settled
headline.print_headline: Home Depot Proxy Fight Is Settled

byline.original: By David Cay Johnston and Julie Creswell

abstract: Home Depot reached an agreement Monday night with a large shareholder, Relational Investors, that will prevent a proxy fight over the company’s strategy. But the move could increase pressure on Home Depot to sell one of its units. Under the terms of the agreement, Relational, a San Diego investment fund, will receive a seat on the company’s board and four directors involved in hiring Robert L. Nardelli, the recently dismissed chief executive, will leave the board in 2008. A founder of Relational, David H. Batchelder, will join the Home Depot board on Feb. 22, and the investment fund will drop its proxy challenge, the two companies said in a joint statement.
lead_paragraph: Home Depot reached an agreement Monday night with a large shareholder, Relational Investors, that will prevent a proxy fight over the company’s strategy. But the move could increase pressure on Home Depot to sell one of its units. Under the terms of the agreement, Relational, a San Diego investment fund, will receive a seat on the company’s board and four directors involved in hiring Robert L. Nardelli, the recently dismissed chief executive, will leave the board in 2008. A founder of Relational, David H. Batchelder, will join the Home Depot board on Feb. 22, and the investment fund will drop its proxy challenge, the two companies said in a joint statement.

headline.main: As Home Depot Settles Proxy Fight, Sale Talk Lingers
